name: Chicken Fajitas
instructions:
In a small bowl, whisk together the chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, smoked paprika, salt, and pepper.

Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the chicken and cook for 5-7 minutes, or until browned and cooked through. Remove from the pan and set aside.

Add the onion and bell peppers to the pan and cook for 3-5 minutes, or until tender. Return the chicken to the pan and sprinkle the seasoning mixture over everything. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, or until heated through. Serve with warm tortillas and your favorite toppings.

name: Vegan Lentil Soup
instructions:
Heat the oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add the onion, carrot, and celery and cook for 5-7 minutes, or until softened.

Add the garlic, thyme, and bay leaves and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes, or until fragrant.

Stir in the lentils, tomatoes, vegetable broth, and water. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer for 30-40 minutes, or until the lentils are tender.

Remove the bay leaves and thyme stems. Season the soup with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot with crusty bread or crackers.

name: Pesto Pasta Salad
instructions:
Cook the pasta according to package directions until al dente. Drain and rinse under cold water until cool.

In a food processor or blender, pulse the basil, garlic, pine nuts, and Parmesan until finely chopped. With the motor running, slowly add the oil until a smooth pesto forms.

In a large bowl, toss the pasta with the pesto. Add the cherry tomatoes and mozzarella, and toss to combine. Serve at room temperature or chilled.

name: Beef Stroganoff
instructions:
In a large pot or Dutch oven, melt the butter over medium-high heat. Add the beef and cook until browned on all sides. Remove the beef from the pot and set aside.

Add the onion and garlic to the pot and cook until the onion is translucent. Stir in the mushrooms and cook until they release their liquid and start to brown.

Add the flour to the pot and stir until it forms a paste. Slowly pour in the beef broth, stirring constantly to prevent lumps. Add the Worcestershire sauce and bring the mixture to a simmer.

Return the beef to the pot and simmer until the sauce has thickened and the beef is tender. Remove from heat and stir in the sour cream. Serve over egg noodles.

name: Vegetable Stir-Fry
instructions:
Heat the oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat. Add the vegetables and stir-fry for 3-5 minutes, or until they are tender-crisp.

In a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, rice vinegar, sesame oil, and cornstarch.

Pour the sauce over the vegetables and stir-fry for an additional 1-2 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened and coated the vegetables. Serve over rice.

name: Spaghetti Carbonara
instructions:
Cook the spaghetti according to package directions until al dente. Drain and reserve 1 cup of the cooking water.

In a large bowl, whisk together the eggs, Parmesan, and black pepper.

In a large skillet, cook the bacon over medium heat until crisp. Remove from the pan and drain on paper towels.

Add the garlic to the pan and cook for 30 seconds, or until fragrant. Remove the pan from the heat.

Add the spaghetti, reserved cooking water, and egg mixture to the skillet. Toss well to combine and coat the spaghetti.

Add the bacon and toss again. Serve hot with additional Parmesan cheese.

name: Beef and Broccoli Stir-Fry
instructions:
In a small bowl, whisk together the cornstarch, soy sauce, rice vinegar, sugar, and red pepper flakes. Set aside.

In a large skillet or wok, heat the oil over high heat. Add the beef and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes, or until browned. Remove the beef from the pan and set aside.

Add the broccoli to the pan and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes, or until tender-crisp. Add the garlic and ginger and stir-fry for an additional 30 seconds, or until fragrant.

Return the beef to the pan and pour the soy sauce mixture over the top. Stir-fry for an additional 1-2 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened and coated the beef and broccoli. Serve over rice.

name: Salmon with Roasted Vegetables
instructions:
Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C). 

In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, garlic, salt, and pepper. 

Arrange the salmon and vegetables on a baking sheet. Brush the olive oil mixture over everything. 

Roast in the oven for 15-20 minutes, or until the salmon is cooked through and the vegetables are tender. 

Serve hot with lemon wedges.

name: Beef and Potato Stew
instructions:
Heat the oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the beef and cook for 5-7 minutes, or until browned. Remove from the pot and set aside.

Add the onion, garlic, carrots, and potatoes to the pot and cook for 3-5 minutes, or until slightly softened. Return the beef to the pot.

In a small bowl, whisk together the beef broth, tomato paste, Worcestershire sauce, thyme, salt, and pepper. Pour the mixture over everything in the pot.

Bring the stew to a boil, then reduce the heat and let simmer for 30-45 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and the beef is cooked through. Serve hot.
